result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan I Booker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 8-4-2023.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
With credit for 109 DAYS served. Good time credit to apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan I Booker

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 125 DAYS in the House of Correction; with credit for 109 DAYS served.  Good time credit to apply. 

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 8-4-2023.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

e-FILED: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Donovan I Booker in court with Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Donovan I Booker in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
EXPEDITED BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 29. Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.   

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

e-Filed: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions/Elements of the Offense
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Donovan I Booker not in court, in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing in the expedited speedy disposition court, Branch 38. Court authorizes transfer and vacates the jury trial on 8/8/22.  Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Donovan I Booker not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION TO ENTRY MADE ON April 22, 2022:  Court ordered $250.00 cash bail.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Donovan I Booker not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Angelyse C.T.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Donovan I Booker in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Donovan I Booker in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donovan I Booker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
